climbs.name: Like Father, Like Son
climbs.fa: Dave Bingham, Dean Hernandez, 8 yo. Cameron Bingham, 2005

content.description:
Short but powerful, this route (boulder problem?) is definitely worth doing if you're wandering around the area.

A thin start on crimps brings you to hidden jugs that pepper the route through its 3 bolts. The further right you go the easier. Sticking to the bolt line is preferred and aiming for the thin diagonal crack can beef things up quite a bit.
content.location: This shorty sits on the N end of the formation on a sweet looking shield of red patina.

content.description: A bolted line with excellent rock.  Step across crack near the top to stay on bolt line.
content.location: To the right of Like Father, Like Son on the West Face.

content.description:
This fun bolted line features technical climbing on smallish holds for the first half and holds that insist on facing the wrong way (read: downward) for the second half.

A few moves on exfoliating choss get you to solid patina jugs and the 2nd bolt. Pull through a steep bulge using funky gastons and sloppy holds and establish below a series of small roofs that all require some form of underclinging to surmount. Keep yourself together when the feet disappear (or lichen renders them useless) and you have to pull one last mantel.
content.protection:
6 or 7 bolts? One of them at least is hard to spot. Backclean the 1st.

Chain anchors, lower or rappel
content.location: Chip off the Old Block climbs the right edge of the large white roof band that sits in the middle of the E face of the formation.
